newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-BETIS FORCED TO IMPROVISE IN CUP SEMIFINAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BETIS FORCED TO IMPROVISE IN CUP SEMIFINAL.

text.p: Spanish Cup favourites Barcelona and Real Betis will be without a number of top foreign players for their semifinal, second leg matches this week.
But whereas Barcelona can rely on one of Europe's strongest squads to defend a 4-0 lead over second division Las Palmas, Betis will field an improvised team for a tough tie at Celta Vigo.
Celta are still smarting over going down to what they believe was an unsporting goal in the first leg.

The only goal of the match was scored by Nenad Bjelica after the Betis midfielder failed to return possession from a throw-in after the Celta defenders had put the ball into touch so that an injured team mate could be treated.

The game had already been interrupted by a string of stoppages for injuries and cramp, all of them suffered by Celta men, and the Betis players were quick to put the blame on the incident on their opponents.
"However much their fans shout, they (the crowd) are not going to score goals," said Betis defender Juan Merino.
For Celta, losing Cup finalists to Zaragoza in 1994, Wednesday's tie represents the last opportunity for success after a mediocre season.
Betis -- who will lose key wingers Robert Jarni and Findi George and three other players to international duty -- have not reached the final for 20 years.
Securing a meeting with Barcelona in this year's final is especially important as it could determine which continental competition the southerners play next season.
With a UEFA Cup place virtually a certainty, Betis currently trail the Catalans only on goal difference in the league.
One of the two clubs looks set to seal Spain's second European Cup place, leaving a berth in the Cup Winners' Cup to a team who finish third in the league and lose the final.
Barcelona manager Bobby Robson is sure enough of a result to rest goalkeeper Vitor Baia, who played a fine game against Valencia on Sunday just 24 hours after turning out for Portugal.
But defenders Gheorghe Popescu and Laurent Blanc and strikers Ronaldo and Emmanuel Amunike will all answer the call of country rather than club on Thursday evening.
Also out is defender Sergi Barjuan who fractured his arm in the first leg.
